attributes.action: Hold a referendum on whether Britain should remain in the EU and abide by the result
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
It is clear that Britain has very little say in the decision making process of the EU and that we are increasingly losing much of our national identity and traditions to European federalism. 

This comes at a high cost to the UK taxpayer for increasingly little benefit.

We need to tell our government that we want to leave the EU and take control of our own political and economic destiny. 

We have heard a lot of late about abuse of expenses procedures by UK MEP's but this is likely to be the tip of the iceberg within the EU.

Already more and more of our large companies are foreign owned and controlled and this is unlikely to lead to them being managed for the benefit of UK citizens. 

It is bad enough trying to hold UK politicians accountable for their actions, but how will we even know where decisions affecting us are being made if they are increasingly taken by faceless, self-interested Euro bureaucrats?

Britain will always be a trading nation but it has done so successfully for thousands of years without the EU and should again.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
